Class Cli

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.triton.launcher.utils.obs.Observable<Message>

    Constructor

    Cli()
    Instantiates a new Cli; The PrintStream out variable is set to System out, by this way System.out.println() is not replicated multiple times.

  • Constructor Details

    • Cli

      public Cli()
      Instantiates a new Cli; The PrintStream out variable is set to System out, by this way System.out.println() is not replicated multiple times.

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      Prints the logo and welcomes the player.

    • init

      public void init()
      Creates the Client to communicate with the Server, asking the IP address of it. Then sets the latter as an Observer of the Cli.

    • askIpAddress

      public void askIpAddress()
      Asks the player to insert the IP address of the server in order to create the socket. If the user doesn't insert anything, it creates the socket on localhost IP address.
      Specified by:
      askIpAddress in interface ClientView

    • isCorrectIpAddress

      private boolean isCorrectIpAddress(String ip)
      This method analyzes the string inserted by the user, applying a pattern that allows the system to know if the string corresponds to an IP address format.
      Parameters:
      ip - the string with the IP address to analyze.
      Returns:
      true if the string corresponds to an IP address, false otherwise.

    • askUsername

      public void askUsername()
      Asks the player to insert the username he wants in the game. Asks the player to insert the username he wants in the game. After that, the server will check if the username is forbidden or already used and, in that case, it'll send back another request asking the username.
      Specified by:
      askUsername in interface ClientView

    • showLoginReply

      public void showLoginReply()
      If the username is correct, it shows to the player that the login is completed.
      Specified by:
      showLoginReply in interface ClientView
      Specified by:
      showLoginReply in interface View

    • askNumPlayersAndGameMode

      public void askNumPlayersAndGameMode()
      Asks only the first player to insert the number of players of the game and the game mode (expert or not).
      Specified by:
      askNumPlayersAndGameMode in interface View

    • askGameMode

      private boolean askGameMode()
      Asks the player to choose the game mode. The first player has to insert 'E' if he wants the expert mode, 'N' otherwise.
      Returns:
      true if the player wants the expert mode, false otherwise.

    • askNumOfPlayers

      private int askNumOfPlayers()
      Asks the first to player to choose the number of players he wants to create the game. Client-side, it checks only if the player inserts a number and not a word. The server will check if the number is 2 or 3 because the game supports only two-players and three-players game.
      Returns:
      the number of player chosen by the first player.

    • showLobbyMessage

      public void showLobbyMessage(List<String> onlineNicknames)
      Shows all the online players.
      Specified by:
      showLobbyMessage in interface ClientView
      Parameters:
      onlineNicknames - the list with the online players.

    • askTowerColor

      public void askTowerColor(boolean[] chosenTowerColors)
      Asks the player to choose his tower color. This method shows only the available tower colors (these have false in their positions in chosenTowerColors array). The player has to insert the number corresponding to the color. If he doesn't input a number or if he inputs an uncorrected number, this method asks again to choose the tower color. Server will check if the color chosen is effectively unused.
      Specified by:
      askTowerColor in interface View
      Parameters:
      chosenTowerColors - the arrays of tower color, available and not.

    • askWizard

      public void askWizard(List<Wizard> wizards)
      Asks the player to choose his wizard. Every wizard is associated to a color. If the player inputs a word that is not a correct color of the game, it will ask again to insert the color of the wizard. The server will check if the color of the wizard chosen by the player is effectively unused.
      Specified by:
      askWizard in interface View
      Parameters:
      wizards - the list of available wizards.

    • showGameInfo

      public void showGameInfo()
      Shows all the game information about school boards, islands, character cards, player's assistant deck and player's wallet.
      Specified by:
      showGameInfo in interface ClientView

    • showGameInfo

      public void showGameInfo(int characterCardId)
      Shows all the game information about school boards, islands, character cards, player's assistant deck and player's wallet. This method is more cleverly used by GUI.
      Specified by:
      showGameInfo in interface ClientView

    • showChangePhase

      public void showChangePhase(GameState gameState)
      Shows to the players that a new game phase is starting (planning phase or action phase).
      Specified by:
      showChangePhase in interface ClientView
      Parameters:
      gameState - the new phase of the game.

    • askAssistantCard

      public void askAssistantCard()
      Asks the player to choose an assistant card to play. This assistant card can be chosen to view the assistant deck which is updated every time the player plays an assistant card removing it. If the player inputs a string which is not an assistant card type, the method will ask again to choose an assistant card. The server will check if the assistant card chosen by the player is already played by him or already played in this turn by other players.
      Specified by:
      askAssistantCard in interface View

    • showInfoAssistantCardPlayed

      public void showInfoAssistantCardPlayed(String username, AssistantCard assistantCard)
      Shows to other players which assistant card the current player has just chosen.
      Specified by:
      showInfoAssistantCardPlayed in interface ClientView
      Parameters:
      username - the current player's username.
      assistantCard - the assistant card just played.

    • showMyInfoAssistantCardPlayed

      public void showMyInfoAssistantCardPlayed(AssistantCard assistantCard)
      Shows to the current player which assistant card he's just played.
      Specified by:
      showMyInfoAssistantCardPlayed in interface ClientView
      Parameters:
      assistantCard - the assistant card played.

    • askMoveStudentFromEntrance

      public void askMoveStudentFromEntrance()
      Asks the player to move a student from his entrance to his dining room or an island. This request is repeated three times (two-players game) or four times (three-players game). The player has to input the color of the student he wants to move and then the destination of the movement: d for dining room, the id of the island for an island [COLOR, d/idIsland]. The server will check if the player has a student of the specified color in his entrance or if the island is existing. During this method, the player can decide to play a character card. In that case, this method calls showAndPlayCharacterCard() to show which character cards are available. When the player finishes playing a character card, the server will go automatically on asking to move the students from entrance.
      Specified by:
      askMoveStudentFromEntrance in interface View

    • askNumberStepsMotherNature

      public void askNumberStepsMotherNature()
      Asks the player to choose how many steps mother nature has to do. This method asks again the number of steps of mother nature if the player doesn't input a number. The server will check if the number inserted by the player is correct (not negative and less than the maximum possible in that round). During this method, the player can decide to play a character card. In that case, this method calls showAndPlayCharacterCard() to show which character cards are available. When the player finishes playing a character card, the server will go automatically on asking the number of steps mother nature has to do.
      Specified by:
      askNumberStepsMotherNature in interface View

    • showGameSummary

      private void showGameSummary()

    • askCloudTile

      public void askCloudTile()
      Asks the player to choose a cloud tile in order to draw the students on it. Each cloud tile is identified by an ID. This method asks again to choose the cloud tile if the player doesn't input a number. The server will check if the id inserted corresponds to an available cloud tile and if this one is not already chosen by another player in that round. During this method, the player can decide to play a character card. In that case, this method calls showAndPlayCharacterCard() to show which character cards are available. When the player finishes playing a character card, the server will go automatically on asking to choose a cloud tile.
      Specified by:
      askCloudTile in interface View

    • askCharacterCardParameters

      public void askCharacterCardParameters(int id)
      Asks the player to insert the parameters of the character card he chose in order to build the effect. This method calls other methods according to the id of the character card the player chose.
      Specified by:
      askCharacterCardParameters in interface View
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the character card the player wants to play.

    • askCharCard01

      public void askCharCard01()
      Asks the parameters of the effect of character card 01. The method checks only if the color inserted by the player exists in the game. The server will check if the student of that color effectively exists.

    • askCharCard03

      public void askCharCard03()
      Asks the parameters of the effect of character card 03. The method checks only if the player inserts a number. The server will check if the island with the id inserted by the player exists.

    • askCharCard05

      public void askCharCard05()
      Asks the parameters of the effect of character card 05. The method checks only if the player inserts a number. If not, it aks again to insert parameters for character card 05. The server will check if the island with the id inserted by the player exists.

    • askCharCard07

      public void askCharCard07()
      Asks the parameters of the effect of character card 07. The method checks only if the player inserts a valid color of the game. If not, it aks again to insert parameters for character card 07. The server will check if the player can swap the selected students and if the character card has the students that the player wants in his school board. The player can swap up to three students. If he wants to swap less than three students, he can press enter when the method asks him to choose a student from the card.

    • ordinal

      private static String ordinal(int i)
      This a helper method used by askCharCard07() and askCharCard10() to print number in an ordinal way. For example, 1 --> 1st, 2-->2nd, ect...
      Parameters:
      i - the number to convert from integer to its ordinal representation.
      Returns:
      ordinal representation.

    • askCharCard09

      public void askCharCard09()
      Asks the parameters of the effect of character card 09. The method checks only if the player inserts a valid color of the game. If not, it aks again to insert parameters for character card 09.

    • askCharCard10

      public void askCharCard10()
      Asks the parameters of the effect of character card 10. The method checks only if the player inserts a valid color of the game. If not, it aks again to insert parameters for character card 10. The server will check if the player has the selected students in his entrance and in his dining room. The player can swap up to three students. If he wants to swap less than three students, he can press enter when the method asks him to choose a student from his entrance.

    • askCharCard11

      public void askCharCard11()
      Asks the parameters of the effect of character card 11. The method checks only if the player inserts a valid color of the game. If not, it aks again to insert parameters for character card 11. The server will check if the card has a student with the color selected by the player.

    • askCharCard12

      public void askCharCard12()
      Asks the parameters of the effect of character card 12. The method checks only if the player inserts a valid color of the game. If not, it aks again to insert parameters for character card 12.

    • showErrorMessage

      public void showErrorMessage(ErrorTypeID errorTypeID)
      Shows to the player which error occurs during the execution of a method or for an invalid input.
      Specified by:
      showErrorMessage in interface View
      Parameters:
      errorTypeID - the error type that occurs during the execution.

    • showDisconnectionMessage

      public void showDisconnectionMessage()
      Shows to the player that another player has disconnected. Then, it disconnects him from the game.
      Specified by:
      showDisconnectionMessage in interface ClientView

    • showEmptyBagMessage

      public void showEmptyBagMessage()
      Shows to the player that the bag is now empty and so, the game will finish at the end of last player's turn. If the bag becomes empty before the action phase, it communicates that the players will not draw any students from the cloud tiles in this turn.
      Specified by:
      showEmptyBagMessage in interface ClientView

    • showInfoStudentIntoDiningRoom

      public void showInfoStudentIntoDiningRoom(String username, String moveDescription)
      Shows to the other players that the current player has just moved a student from his entrance to his dining room.
      Specified by:
      showInfoStudentIntoDiningRoom in interface ClientView
      Parameters:
      username - the current player's username.
      moveDescription - the description of the move.

      Specified by:
      showInfoStudentOntoIsland in interface ClientView
      Parameters:

      moveDescription - the description of the move.

      Specified by:

      Parameters:

    • showChangeInfluenceMessage

      public void showChangeInfluenceMessage(String username, int islandId)
      Shows to the players that an island has a new dominator. Then, it prints all the updated islands.
      Specified by:
      showChangeInfluenceMessage in interface ClientView
      Parameters:
      username - the new island dominator's username.
      islandId - the id of the island.

    • showMergeIslandsMessage

      public void showMergeIslandsMessage(int island1Id, int island2Id)
      Shows to the players that an island is merged with another one. Then, it prints all the remaining islands.
      Specified by:
      showMergeIslandsMessage in interface ClientView
      Parameters:
      island1Id - the id of the island merged with mother nature.
      island2Id - the id of the island merged to delete.

    • showMoveTowerOntoIsland

      public void showMoveTowerOntoIsland(int islandId)
      Shows to the players that a tower has been moved onto an island. Then, it prints all the islands.
      Specified by:
      showMoveTowerOntoIsland in interface ClientView
      Parameters:
      islandId - the id of the island where a new tower is built.

    • showMoveTowerOntoSchoolBoard

      public void showMoveTowerOntoSchoolBoard(String username, SchoolBoard schoolBoard)
      Shows to the players that a tower has been moved back onto a school board.
      Specified by:
      showMoveTowerOntoSchoolBoard in interface ClientView
      Parameters:
      username - the school board owner's username.
      schoolBoard - the school board with new towers.

    • showInfoChosenCloudTile

      public void showInfoChosenCloudTile(String username, String choiceDescription)

      Specified by:
      showInfoChosenCloudTile in interface ClientView
      Parameters:
      username - the current player's username.
      choiceDescription - the description of the chosen cloud tile.

    • showUpdateWallet

      public void showUpdateWallet()
      Shows to the current player the new amount of coins in his wallet.
      Specified by:
      showUpdateWallet in interface ClientView

    • showTieMessage

      public void showTieMessage()
      Shows to the player that he has tied the game. Then, it asks if he wants to play again.
      Specified by:
      showTieMessage in interface ClientView

    • showWinMessage

      public void showWinMessage()
      Shows to the winner player that he won the game. Then, it asks if he wants to play again.
      Specified by:
      showWinMessage in interface ClientView

    • showLoseMessage

      public void showLoseMessage(String winnerUsername)
      Shows to the loser players who won the game.
      Specified by:
      showLoseMessage in interface ClientView
      Parameters:
      winnerUsername - the winner's username.

    • askPlayAgain

      public void askPlayAgain()
      Asks the player if he wants to play again. The player has to reply with "yes/y" if he wants to play again, "no/n" otherwise. In case he wants to play again, this method clears the screen and asks the new username else it interrupts the input read thread and closes the connection with the server.
      Specified by:
      askPlayAgain in interface ClientView

    • showGenericMessage

      public void showGenericMessage(String genericMessage)
      Shows to the player a generic message.
      Specified by:
      showGenericMessage in interface ClientView
      Parameters:
      genericMessage - the string to print.

    • showAndPlayCharacterCard

      private void showAndPlayCharacterCard()
      Shows to the current player the available character cards. Then it asks the player to input the id of the character card he wants to play. The method checks only if the player inserts a number. The server will check if the number inserted by the player is an id of an available character card. This method can be called once per turn by pressing "--playCC" during the action phase.

    • showAbortMessage

      public void showAbortMessage()
      Shows to the player that a fatal error occurs during the execution of the game and the connection with the server dropped. Then, it closes the game.
      Specified by:
      showAbortMessage in interface ClientView

    • removeSpaces

      private String removeSpaces(String string)
      This method is useful for removing the spaces when the player inputs the student he wants to move from his entrance.
      Parameters:
      string - the string to modify
      Returns:
      the string without spaces.

    • readLine

      public String readLine() throws NullPointerException
      Read a string line using a separated thread.
      Returns:
      the string in input.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - when a fatal error occurs.

    • getClientModel

      public ClientModel getClientModel()
      Specified by:
      getClientModel in interface ClientView
      Returns:
      the client model of the player.
